intro: Rubia cruciata, commonly known as crosswort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 10,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Rubia cruciata is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
